alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 27 at 2:13PM MST until August 27 at 5:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Agua Fria River in... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 515 PM MST. * At 211 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over and upstream from the Agua Fria River and Black Canyon Creek. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Agua Fria River. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Agua Fria River. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Black Canyon City, Hazlett Hollow Campground and Turney Gulch Group Campground. This includes the following highways... Interstate 17 between mile markers 243 and 247. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Rock Creek, Castle Creek, Black Canyon, Jim Creek, Squaw Creek, Willow Creek, Badger Spring Wash, North Fork Rock Creek, Silver Creek, Indian Creek, Boulder Creek, Humbug Creek, Ash Creek, Larry Creek, Poland Creek, Big Bug Creek, Sycamore Creek, Slate Creek, Antelope Creek, Agua Fria River, Black Canyon Creek, Bishop Creek and Tank Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Immediately move out of and away from creeks and washes in the Agua Fria River. Flash flooding is occurring or imminent. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
